topic.title: Managing user preferences
topic.shortdesc: User preferences are changing from the menu Settings

body.p: Each authenticated user has the ability to change their preferences.
The Settings menu is at the top and right of the interface, from any page.

section.title: Main Tab
section.p: Users can edit personal information here: First name, Surname, Email addresses, phone numbers, language, etc.
section.note: Some fields are not editable if they come from an LDAP directory.
section.p: The user can add email addresses and select the default address, which will be used for sending notifications.
The user may also specify certain default behaviors of the application, such as the profile and the default select entity when connecting to the interface (see and ).
The experienced user may also choose to exit the normal mode of the application by selecting one of the following fashion :

ul.li: In translation mode, text strings depending on the locale are identified; this mode allows the translator to find and easier to translate text strings.

In debug mode, GLPI displays errors, all values of variables, SQL queries, etc. It is useful to enable this mode in case of GLPI malfunction. Thus much information can be communicated to the developers of the GLPI project. This mode also allows to have information additional on various objects in a specific tab (notifications, etc.).

section.title: Personal View tab
section.p: This tab allows you to reset the display customization of the various lists. The user can, for each type of object, return to the default display by removing this customization (see ).
